title: The Walking Dead season 10 credits now come with a Rick Grimes Easter Egg
text:
The Walking Dead has thrown in a reference to Rick Grimes’ last episode (Picture: AMC)

The Walking Dead season 10 has a nice Rick Grimes Easter Egg worked in to the opening credits.

The credits sequence detailing key objects and moments from the series includes a moment from Rick’s (Andrew Lincoln) final episode in season nine.

He bowed out in the episode What Comes After, which saw a wounded Rick stare down a horde of undead on a bridge that was built to unite the communities.

This scene now plays out briefly in the titles of season 10 as executive producer Robert Kirkman’s name appears.

In the illustration a figure stands on one end of the bridge with a gun raised at the walkers as they make their way towards him.

Shortly after the same bridge is up in flames and completely destroyed in the centre, preventing anything from getting across.

This is likely in reference to the moment Rick fires his gun at a stack of dynamite, killing the walkers and – seemingly – himself to the dismay of the rest of the survivors.

The bridge goes up in flames (Picture: AMC)

Andrew Lincoln’s Rick Grimes left the show in season nine (Picture: AMC)

However as viewers know Rick was actually whisked away to an unknown location by helicopter.

Rick is also spotted later on in the credits on horseback with Michonne (Danai Gurira), and her iconic sword can be seen stuck upright in the ground.

Season 10 will of course see the departure of Danai as she steps down from her role.

Showrunner Angela Kang can’t wait for us to see the warrior woman’s exit, revealing that the character ‘showcases her leadership and strength, and her love for her people and her family’ in her final episodes.

Angela enthused to TV Line: ‘I’m excited to have the audience see Danai’s work during this last arc on the show because she’s just amazing.’

In the meantime fans have seen the popular show return with an unexpected opening set in space.

The Walking Dead airs Sundays on AMC in the US and follows a day later at 9pm on Fox UK.
